intro: Boerlagiodendron caudatum, commonly known as the long-tailed boerlagia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a small, capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
